briefTitle: Long Term Outcomes of Therapy in Women Initiated on Lifelong ART Because of Pregnancy in DR Congo
officialTitle: Continuous Quality Improvement Interventions to Improve Long Term Outcomes of Antiretroviral Therapy in Women Initiated on Therapy During Pregnancy or Breastfeeding in the Democratic Republic of Congo

protocolDocument.label: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan

eligibilityCriteria.criteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* All women diagnosed with HIV during pregnancy or breastfeeding in the participating maternal and child health (MCH) clinics and initiated on antiretroviral therapy (ART) during the enrollment period

Exclusion Criteria:

* Refuse to participate
* Clinics will be excluded if less than 500 pregnant women (less than 5 HIV-infected pregnant women) registered for antenatal care (ANC) in the clinic in 2015

primary.description: the proportion of participants for whom the whereabouts is unknown at the evaluation time
primary.timeFrame: delivery, six weeks, 12 and 24 weeks postpartum

primary.description: Proportion of participants with undetectable viral load

secondary.description: Proportion of HIV-exposed infant with an appropriate HIV test result
secondary.timeFrame: delivery, six weeks, 12 and 24 weeks postpartum

secondary.description: Proportion of HIV-infected participants (mother or infant) initiated on ART within two weeks of diagnosis
Proportion of HIV-exposed infant who test positive for HIV
secondary.timeFrame: delivery, six weeks, 12 and 24 weeks postpartum

secondary.description: Proportion of participating mothers and infants know to be alive
secondary.timeFrame: delivery, six weeks, 12 and 24 weeks postpartum
